result.execSummary:
The defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Participate and follow through with any assessments, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.

miscConds.notes: Court grants a special disposition that if probation is completed successfully defendant will be granted expungement 973.015

timeConds.notes: Defendant to report to jail at the direction of probation agent within the first 90 days of probation.  EM approved.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard, defendant is ready to proceed. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews elements with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the min/max penalties. Defendant states understanding. 

346.04(2)(t) Defendant plead guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 

State is heard on sentencing. 
Atty Key is heard on sentencing.
Defendant has no comment. 

Court orders...probation for 1 year - withhold sentence. Conditions of probation are that defendant participate and follow through with any assessments, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections. During first 90 days of probation, defendant is to serve 20 days in the county jail, EM approved. Defendant to report to jail at the direction of probation agent within the first 90 days of probation. Court has no objection for defendant to serve through another county.  Court grants a special disposition that if probations is completed successfully defendant will be granted expungement 973.015. Bond to be applied. 2 days jail credit - does not count toward the 20 day jail imposed.  Court costs $443.00. $150.00 bond to be applied.  

PP approved. $50.00 per month. Commencing September 1, 2022
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:09 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard on the non-appearance of the defendant. 

State is heard, requests a warrant for non-appearance. 
Atty Key is heard and requests a plea and sentencing. 

Court will set plea and sentencing date and not issue a warrant at this time.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Jury status hearing on July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Request by Atty Key's Office to reschedule the 6/30/22 jury status hearing due to a scheduling conflict.  No objection by DA Steiner.  JA approved and rescheduled to 7/7/22 at 9:00 AM by Zoom.

2:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard. Defendant will be waiving right to preliminary hearing. 

Court reviews preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Key is ready to move forward with the arraignment today. 

Defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record.
Jury status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:36 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy appeared by phone, Attorney Daniel M Key for Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Atty Key is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000416,
Payable Number: 70307,
Receipt Number: 22R 000716,
Amount: $20.00

2:08 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy appeared by phone, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on status of retaining an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:43 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Def comments on the process of retaining counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:37 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Continued so defendant can retain an attorney.

Clerk to mail out a petition to defendant for a court appointed attorney along with NOH.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Per Public Defender, Mr. Murphy IS NOT ELIGIBLE for public defender atty.  nad
Adjourned initial appearance on January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

4:00 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Zechariah Merlyn Jean Murphy appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Def. states PD's office stated they could not represent on citations - Court advises def. that he has now been charged with a Felony - should reach out to the PD's office again and advise them of that.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Zechariah MJ Murphy appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause. 
DA Requests a cash bond of $150.00 with standard conditions. Defendant comments. DA - there is no non-monetary conditions requested.
Court orders a cash bond of $150.00 with standard conditions.   
Court advises of right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Hearing on January 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
